title: Pear blueberry quinoa crumbles

ingredients.content: 4 ripe pears, peeled, cored and cut into dice (see Tips)
50 g raw hazelnuts, with skins on
½ tsp ground cardamom, plus extra to serve
70 g butter, cut into cubes (2 cm)

preparations.content: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh blueberries and 20 g of the sugar into it. Add pears to the bowl and stir to combine. Divide fruit mixture evenly between 6 ovenproof bowls or ramekins (250 ml capacity) and set aside.
Place hazelnuts into mixing bowl and mill <b>15 sec/speed 9<b> or until finely ground. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add quinoa flakes, flour, coconut, cardamom, butter and remaining 30 g sugar and mix <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>, then knead <b>20 sec/<b>.
Sprinkle crumble mixture over fruit and bake for 25 minutes (160°C), or until crumble is golden and fruit is tender. Serve warm with yoghurt and an extra sprinkle of cardamom, if desired.

hintsAndTricks: You can use‚ whichever berries are in season in these crumbles, or frozen berries if you prefer.

If your pears are firm you will need to bake the crumble for a bit longer. You may also need to cover your crumbles with aluminium foil to prevent the topping from getting too brown while the pear cooks.
You can use your preferred brown sugar in these crumbles – either regular brown sugar or a less refined option such as Rapadura sugar (Panela) or coconut sugar.
If you prefer, you can substitute the ground cardamom with ground cinnamon.
You can also substitute quinoa flakes with rolled oats or use a mixture of oats and quinoa flakes.
